page.title: 20Housing in Curry Rivel
page.content: The houses in 1985 have changed considerably since the time of the original Doomsday Book. Curry Rivel is a big village with many people moving in and out. The oldest house in the village is Hillards Farm, the house was built in the 11th century. In West Curry Rivel the most popular buildings are 17th century stone detached houses with tile rooves. In East Curry Rivel most buildings are 20th century detached houses made of reconstituted stone with tile rooves. The most common buildings in Central Curry Rivel are late 18th century, semi-detached houses, made of stone with tile rooves. The stone used to make the houses comes from quarries on Ham Hill about 10 miles away. The majority of new houses are found in East Curry Rivel and the pre-18th century buildings are in West Curry.
